Package com.quantum.axe

Class AxeHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.quantum.axe.AxeHelper
  • public class AxeHelper
extends Object
    A helper class that wraps the functionality of the Axe accessibility testing library. This code will inject the Axe library into the web browser at the end of a Selenium session and then expose the Axe API to Java.

    It's an incomplete proof of concept as yet...

    • Field Detail

      • AXE_DEFAULT

        public static final String AXE_DEFAULT
        The default AXE URL used by script injection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • runAxeScript

        public static final String runAxeScript
        A script that executes all of the Axe rule. Since Axe executes asynchronously, the results of the accessibility tests are made available in a callback. So, this function returns true to signal that the accessibility tests have started. The results are checked by polling.

      • startHighlighterScript

        public static final String startHighlighterScript

      • checkAxeSuccessScript

        public static final String checkAxeSuccessScript
        A script that executes within a polling loop to determine whether the Axe accessibility test has completed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • axeEverything

        public AxeTestResultContainer axeEverything()
                                     throws InterruptedException
        Run all of the Axe rules. Note that this is known to cause problems if there are a very large number of errors: a problem occurs in older iOS versions which seems to be due to the size of the returned JSON object. The work around is to run smaller sets of rules.
        Returns:
        The test results.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • runAxe

        public void runAxe()
        Run axe storing the results in document.perfectoAxeResult on the browser;

      • startHighlighter

        public boolean startHighlighter​(String type)
        The highlighter is an iterator over axe violations. It should be called after AXE has run.
        Parameters:
        type -
        Returns:
